001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.annotations.HandleUiException;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.log.LogUi;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.decorators.WebElementDecorator;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.enums.WebElementAction;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.handling.ExceptionHandlingWebElement;
008import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.locating.SmartFinder;
009import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressFBWarnings;
010import java.time.Duration;
011import java.util.Arrays;
012import java.util.List;
013import java.util.Objects;
014import java.util.Optional;
015import java.util.function.Consumer;
016import java.util.function.Function;
017import lombok.Getter;
018import lombok.Setter;
019import lombok.SneakyThrows;
020import org.jspecify.annotations.NullMarked;
021import org.openqa.selenium.By;
022import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
023import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
024import org.openqa.selenium.interactions.Actions;
025import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedCondition;
026import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;
027import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.WebDriverWait;
028
029import static io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.config.UiConfigHolder.getUiConfig;
030
031/**
032 * A custom wrapper for {@link WebElement} that enhances interactions by adding wait mechanisms,
033 * exception handling, and support for Shadow DOM elements.
034 *
035 * <p>It integrates with Selenium while providing additional functionality such as smart waiting,
036 * exception management, and Shadow DOM compatibility.
037 *
038 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
039 */
040@SuppressFBWarnings(value = "CT_CONSTRUCTOR_THROW", justification = "Constructor validates inputs properly "
041      + "and throwing exceptions is acceptable.")
042public class SmartWebElement extends WebElementDecorator {
043
044   @Getter
045   @Setter
046   private WebDriver driver;
047   private final WebDriverWait wait;
048
049   /**
050    * Constructs a {@code SmartWebElement} wrapping the given {@link WebElement}.
051    *
052    * @param original The original {@link WebElement} instance.
053    * @param driver   The {@link WebDriver} instance.
054    */
055   public SmartWebElement(WebElement original, WebDriver driver) {
056      super(original);
057      if (driver == null) {
058         throw new IllegalArgumentException("driver must not be null");
059      }
060      this.driver = driver;
061      this.wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, Duration.ofSeconds(getUiConfig().waitDuration()));
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Finds multiple {@link SmartWebElement}s matching the given {@link By} locator.
066    *
067    * @param by The {@link By} locator used to find elements.
068    * @return A list of {@link SmartWebElement}, or an empty list if no elements are found.
069    */
070   @HandleUiException
071   public List<SmartWebElement> findSmartElements(By by) {
072      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
073         return SmartFinder.findElementsNoWrap(this, by);
074      }
075
076      try {
077         if (getUiConfig().useShadowRoot()) {
078            return SmartFinder.findElementsWithShadowRootElement(this, by, this::waitWithoutFailure);
079         } else {
080            return SmartFinder.findElementsNormally(this, by, this::waitWithoutFailure);
081         }
082      } catch (Exception e) {
083         return handleException("findElements", e, new Object[] {by});
084      }
085   }
086
087   /**
088    * Finds a single {@link SmartWebElement} using the given {@link By} locator.
089    *
090    * @param by The {@link By} locator used to find the element.
091    * @return The found {@link SmartWebElement}, or handles the exception if the element is not found.
092    */
093   @HandleUiException
094   public SmartWebElement findSmartElement(By by) {
095      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
096         return SmartFinder.findElementNoWrap(this, by);
097      }
098      try {
099         if (getUiConfig().useShadowRoot()) {
100            return SmartFinder.findElementWithShadowRootElement(this, by, this::waitWithoutFailure);
101         } else {
102            return SmartFinder.findElementNormally(this, by, this::waitWithoutFailure);
103         }
104      } catch (Exception e) {
105         return handleException("findElement", e, new Object[] {by});
106      }
107   }
108
109   /**
110    * Clicks the element, ensuring it is clickable before performing the action.
111    */
112   @Override
113   @HandleUiException
114   public void click() {
115      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
116         original.click();
117         return;
118      }
119      performActionWithWait(element -> super.click(), WebElementAction.CLICK.getMethodName());
120   }
121
122   /**
123    * Performs a double-click action on the element.
124    */
125   @HandleUiException
126   public void doubleClick() {
127      Actions actions = new Actions(driver);
128      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
129         actions.doubleClick();
130         return;
131      }
132      try {
133         waitWithoutFailure(ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(this));
134         actions.doubleClick();
135      } catch (Exception e) {
136         handleException("doubleClick", e, new Object[0]);
137      }
138   }
139
140   /**
141    * Clears the text inside the element, ensuring it is interactable.
142    */
143   @Override
144   @HandleUiException
145   public void clear() {
146      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
147         original.clear();
148         return;
149      }
150      performActionWithWait(element -> super.clear(), WebElementAction.CLEAR.getMethodName());
151   }
152
153   /**
154    * Sends keystrokes to the element, ensuring it is interactable.
155    *
156    * @param keysToSend The sequence of keys to send.
157    */
158   @Override
159   @NullMarked
160   public void sendKeys(CharSequence... keysToSend) {
161      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
162         original.sendKeys(keysToSend);
163         return;
164      }
165      performActionWithWait(element -> super.sendKeys(keysToSend), WebElementAction.SEND_KEYS.getMethodName());
166   }
167
168   /**
169    * Submits the form associated with this element.
170    */
171   @Override
172   public void submit() {
173      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
174         original.submit();
175         return;
176      }
177      performActionWithWait(element -> super.submit(), WebElementAction.SUBMIT.getMethodName());
178   }
179
180   /**
181    * Clears the element and then sends the specified keys.
182    *
183    * @param keysToSend The sequence of keys to send.
184    */
185   public void clearAndSendKeys(CharSequence... keysToSend) {
186      clear();
187      sendKeys(keysToSend);
188   }
189
190   /**
191    * Checks whether the element is enabled and visible.
192    *
193    * @return {@code true} if the element is enabled and visible, otherwise {@code false}.
194    */
195   public boolean isEnabledAndVisible() {
196      waitWithoutFailure(ExpectedConditions.and(
197            ExpectedConditions.visibilityOf(this),
198            ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(this)
199      ));
200      return true;
201   }
202
203   /**
204    * Handles exceptions by searching for predefined exception handling strategies.
205    *
206    * @param methodName The method where the exception occurred.
207    * @param exception  The thrown exception.
208    * @param params     The method parameters.
209    * @return The handled result or rethrows the exception if no strategy is found.
210    */
211   @SneakyThrows
212   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
213   private <T> T handleException(String methodName, Exception exception, Object[] params) {
214      Throwable cause = exception.getCause() != null ? exception.getCause() : exception;
215
216      Optional<ExceptionHandlingWebElement> exceptionHandlingOptional =
217            Arrays.stream(ExceptionHandlingWebElement.values())
218                  .filter(enumVal ->
219                        enumVal.getMethodName().equals(methodName)
220                              && Objects.nonNull(enumVal.getExceptionHandlingMap().get(cause.getClass()))
221                  )
222                  .findFirst();
223
224      if (exceptionHandlingOptional.isPresent()) {
225         try {
226            return (T) exceptionHandlingOptional.get()
227                  .getExceptionHandlingMap()
228                  .get(cause.getClass())
229                  .apply(driver, this, exception, params);
230         } catch (Exception handlerException) {
231            LogUi.error("Framework attempted to handle an exception in method '" + methodName
232                  + "', but the handler failed with: " + handlerException.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": "
233                  + handlerException.getMessage(), handlerException);
234            exception.addSuppressed(handlerException);
235            LogUi.error("Propagating original exception: " + exception.getClass().getSimpleName()
236                  + ": " + exception.getMessage(), exception);
237            throw exception;
238         }
239      } else {
240         String locator = (params.length > 0 && params[0] instanceof By) ? params[0].toString() : "Unknown locator";
241         String exceptionMessage = exception.getClass().getSimpleName();
242
243         String errorMessage = String.format(
244               "[BROKEN] Exception handling failed for method '%s'. Exception: '%s'. Parameters: Locator - '%s'.",
245               methodName, exceptionMessage, locator
246         );
247         LogUi.error(errorMessage);
248         throw exception;
249      }
250   }
251
252   /**
253    * Returns the string representation of the original WebElement.
254    *
255    * @return The string representation of the wrapped WebElement.
256    */
257   @Override
258   public String toString() {
259      return original.toString();
260   }
261
262   /**
263    * Executes a waiting condition while suppressing failures.
264    *
265    * @param expectedConditions The condition to wait for.
266    */
267   private <T> void waitWithoutFailure(Function<WebDriver, T> expectedConditions) {
268      try {
269         wait.until(expectedConditions);
270      } catch (Exception ignore) {
271         //ignore wait failure
272      }
273   }
274
275   /**
276    * Performs an action on the element after waiting for it to become clickable.
277    *
278    * @param action     The action to perform.
279    * @param actionName The name of the action being performed.
280    */
281   private void performActionWithWait(Consumer<SmartWebElement> action, String actionName) {
282      try {
283         waitWithoutFailure(ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(this));
284         action.accept(this);
285      } catch (Exception e) {
286         handleException(actionName, e, new Object[0]);
287      }
288   }
289
290   /**
291    * Waits until an element's attribute value changes from its initial value.
292    *
293    * @param attributeName         The name of the attribute.
294    * @param initialAttributeValue The initial value of the attribute.
295    */
296   public void waitUntilAttributeValueIsChanged(String attributeName, String initialAttributeValue) {
297      WebDriverWait customWait = new WebDriverWait(driver, Duration.ofSeconds(2));
298      try {
299         customWait.until(attributeValueChanged(attributeName, initialAttributeValue));
300      } catch (Exception ignore) {
301         //ignore wait failure
302      }
303   }
304
305
306   private ExpectedCondition<Boolean> attributeValueChanged(final String attributeName, final String initialValue) {
307      return webDriver -> {
308         String currentValue = getDomAttribute(attributeName);
309         return !initialValue.equals(currentValue);
310      };
311   }
312
313}
